thread.title: Lightning trade Ben Bishop to Kings
thread.title_full: Lightning trade Ben Bishop to Kings

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Lightning trade Ben Bishop to Kings
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Lightning trade Ben Bishop to Kings Hours after missing Sunday’s practice with the flu, the Tampa Bay Lightning traded goalie Ben Bishop to the Los Angeles Kings, the teams confirmed Sunday night. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Lightning trade Ben Bishop to Kings USA TODAY Sports 6:58 p.m. ET Feb. 26, 2017 Ben Bishop has a 2.55 goals-against average and .911 save percentage this season. (Photo: Bruce Fedyck, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Hours after missing Sunday’s practice with the flu, the Tampa Bay Lightning traded goalie Ben Bishop to the Los Angeles Kings, the teams confirmed Sunday night. 
The Lightning receive prospect defenseman Erik Cernak, Peter Budaj, a seventh-round pick in 2017 and a conditional pick. Budaj had been the Kings’ No. 1 goalie while Jonathan Quick, who injured himself in the first game of the season and returned Saturday, was out with a groin injury. The Lightning also sent a 2017 fifth-round pick to Los Angeles. 
Bishop will become an unrestricted free agent this offseason. The 30-year-old is in the final season of a two-year, $11.9 million deal.Quick has won two Stanley Cups with the Kings, and he has a Conn Smythe as playoff MVP during the Kings' Stanley Cup run in 2011-12 on his resume. It’s unlikely Bishop would take his job, unless Quick’s health is a question mark. 
Bishop played in the Stanley Cup final in 2015, when the Lightning lost to the Blackhawks in six games. 
The Kings are three points out of the final wild card spot in the Western Conference. The Lightning are seven points out.
